Harboring/Aiding a Felon (E/F/G/H/I or unclassified felony/not life)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kamari M Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Traffic/Ordinance Violation [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 10 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County or the State of Illionois for purposes of attending school.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.

No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
No contact with the co-actors listed in the Criminal Complaint.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed in court.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Kelly Pingel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Kamari M Hudson in court with attorney Eugene E. Detert.  

State is orally amending count 3 to Escape (Party to); 946.42(2)(a) and 939.05.
State filed an amended information.
Defense has no objections.

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to the amended charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the amended charge.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.



Court orders the following:
6 Months in the Waukesha County Jail - Straight-Time.
10 Days Credit.
STAYED.


Term of Probation: 9 Months.
Court will allow for transfer to Milwaukee County or the State of Illinois for purposes of attending school.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
No Use or Possession of a controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No contact with:  Co-Actors listed in the criminal complaint.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Costs: $243
DNA Sample and Surcharge: $200
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 4, 2015 at 09:30 am.
